Posts.Content: Jun 3, 2009 07:04PM pinkmama wrote: Hi Again, I start my Chemo on Wednesday, June 10th.  I am doing TCH 6X.  Anyone else on this treatment? Rinna, thanks for that updated and condensed list.  I printed it out today.  Did anyone ask their Onco. about taking over the counter meds for different side effects?  Mine said not to buy anything that he will prescribe what is needed, but I'm afraid that I will be sick with no relief  and suffer unneccessarily. Does anyone have any comments on this?
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2009 08:00PM pinkmama wrote: Hi There, Well, I did it!!!!!  My first Chemo today.  It was not anywhere near as difficult as I thought it would be.  Day before: 2 pills of decodron in the morning  2 in the evening IV saline      decadron     kytril     taxotere   every15 minutes for 1 hour, increasing cc 's until full.     herceptin x2     Carboplatin Dry mouth, slight weird taste, but minimum.  A little wound up from the Decadron.  hope I can sleep. Wishing good treatments to all of you.  Hope you breeze right through. 1 down 5 to go whoo whoo!!!!!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2009 09:55AM pinkmama wrote: EngTchr:  Becky, I have the same exact program as you do.  I went Wednesday for my first one and honestly, I worried for nothing and I was soooooo stressed out.   I'm at day 3, worked yesterday and I'm fine other than little insignificant symptoms. I little fogged out yesterday (i think due to decodron) but today that feeling is gone.  The waiting is the biggest problem. Your mind just wanders. Good luck and looking forward to hearing how uneventful your 1st treatment will be!!! Jamie
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2009 07:33PM pinkmama wrote: Hello, Today was my day 4 of my 1st round of TCH and I slept much of the day away    I was wiped out.  Slight nausea with a terrible foggy feeling.  I feel like I'm in the twilight zone.  Certain foods/drinks taste "off".  Some weird symptoms, constipation, bloody nose did i say foggy????? Yesterday I was walking laps and feeling pretty good, I guess I'll be down for the next few days.   I'm trying to get a handle on the hi's and low's so next round will be easier to plan my life around.  I think knowing what to expect helps a little bit.     Hope you guys are doing okay with your SE's.   Jamie
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 15, 2009 06:47PM pinkmama wrote: Hi gang, It's been a ride.  Just as a reminder, i'm doing TCH.  I'm now on day 6 of this roller coaster ride.  Day 4 was a write off.....slept the day away.  Day 5 was slightly better (that was yesterday)  I managed a walk and only napped in the morning.  I find mornings are difficult.  I feel slightly nauseas and groggy.  As I eat and the day goes on I feel better, (not good, but better).   Food is an issue.  Many things put me off.  I cannot tolerate the taste of so many things I would otherwise love.  Everything has a bad taste.   fruit seems to taste good. Watch the spicy stuff, not good for indigestion.  Feeling bad makes me crabby.    Chemo sucks..... It really does!!!!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: May 27, 2009 09:45PM pinkmama wrote: I just want to share this....maybe it will help.   After my segmental mastectomy, I developed cording from under my arm down to my wrist and down my back.  It was very painful. I was reaching a point that I was ready to get in touch with a physio therapist but.  Before I did, I bought a small hand messager and my arm started  to feel better immediately.   I am still numb in some areas but I keep running the massager on the area and each day it gets better and better.  I had my surgery in April and I have almost totally full range of motion and can even do an hour of aerobics with 2 lb. weights.  I am working my way up slowly. (you have to be carefull or you can get lymphadema.)
Posts.Title: Numbness in Arm After Surgery DENTHOMAS pinkmama
